title: Macquarie Media boss exits ahead of Nine acquisition
text:
Macquarie Media chief executive Adam Lang will depart the radio broadcaster ahead of Nine taking full control of the business by the end of the year.

The announcement ends months of speculation about Mr Lang's future after Nine made a move on the 45.5 per cent of Macquarie it didn't already own in August.

Macquarie CEO Adam Lang is leaving.

Macquarie chairman Russell Tate said he and Mr Lang agreed he will leave the company, where he has been chief executive since April 2018, at the end of this week. He was previously chief operating officer for three years following the merger of Macquarie and Fairfax Radio, where he had been managing director for three years.

"Adam and I have been in discussion for some time about his future opportunities within Macquarie, which will undergo significant change in the next few months as our operations are integrated with those of Nine Entertainment Corporation," Mr Tate said in a statement to the ASX.

"Nine is in the process of moving towards 100 per cent ownership and control of Macquarie, and it is expected that the role of Macquarie Media CEO will become redundant under the consequential organisation structure."
description: Chief executive Adam Lang has ended months of speculation about his future.
